topic.title: Preface

section.title: About This Guide
section.p: This documentation provides comprehensive guidance for using Lingua Workbench, a personal language learning platform for studying spoken English from authentic audio sources.

section.title: Who Should Use This Guide
section.p: This guide is intended for:

ul.li: Language learners who want to improve their English listening skills through TV shows and movies
Developers who want to set up and customize the platform
Contributors who want to understand the system architecture

section.title: How This Guide is Organized
section.p: This guide is divided into the following parts:

ul.li: Getting Started Installation and first-run instructions
User Guide Step-by-step procedures for using all features
Reference Lookup information for controls, tags, and technical details
Troubleshooting Solutions to common problems
Appendix Additional reference materials

section.title: Conventions Used
section.p: This documentation uses the following conventions:

ul.li: Bold text in boxes indicates UI buttons or controls
Monospace text indicates code, commands, or file paths
Bold text indicates important terms or emphasis

topic.domains: (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
topic.title: Notices

section.title: Copyright
section.p: Copyright 2026 [Your Name]. All rights reserved.
This documentation is provided for personal and educational use only.

ul.li: Vue.js is a trademark of Evan You.
Django is a registered trademark of the Django Software Foundation.
OpenAI and Whisper are trademarks of OpenAI, Inc.
All other trademarks are the property of their respective owners.

section.title: Third-Party Services
section.p: This application uses the following third-party services:

ul.li: OpenAI API For phonetic analysis and dictionary features
Whisper API For speech-to-text transcription

section.p: Usage of these services is subject to their respective terms of service and pricing.

section.title: Disclaimer
section.p: This software is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. The author is not responsible for any damages arising from the use of this software.

topic.title: Revision History

body.p: This section documents the revision history of Lingua Workbench.

ul.li: Initial release
Audio management (upload, chunk, slice)
Whisper transcription integration
AI phonetic analysis (Sound Script)
Dictionary with bilingual examples
Playback speed control
Favorite marking
Time adjustment arrows
Independent slice deletion

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: Product Overview
concept.shortdesc: Lingua Workbench is a personal language learning platform for studying spoken English.

section.title: What is Lingua Workbench?
section.p: Lingua Workbench helps you analyze and study spoken English from audio sources like TV shows and movies. It provides tools for:

ul.li: Uploading and managing audio files organized by drama/season/episode
Creating precise audio slices from longer recordings
AI-powered transcription and phonetic analysis
Context-aware dictionary lookups

section.title: Key Features
section.p: The platform includes:

ul.li: Audio Slicer - Interactive waveform selection and region management
Sound Script Analysis - AI-generated phonetic breakdown of phrases
Dictionary Integration - Bilingual definitions with contextual examples
Playback Controls - Variable speed, loop, and region playback

section.title: Target Audience
section.p: This tool is designed for English learners who want to master natural spoken English through authentic audio sources.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Installing Lingua Workbench
task.shortdesc: Set up the development environment for Lingua Workbench.

prereq.p: Before you begin, ensure you have:

ul.li: Node.js 20+ or 22+
Python 3.11+
ffmpeg (for audio processing)
Git

context.p: Lingua Workbench consists of a Vue 3 frontend and Django backend. Both need to be set up separately.

step.cmd: Clone the repository:
Set up the frontend:

substep.cmd: Navigate to the frontend directory: cd frontend

step.cmd: Set up the backend:

substep.cmd: Navigate to the backend directory: cd ../backend
Create a virtual environment: python -m venv venv

step.cmd: Create environment files with your API keys.

result.p: Both frontend and backend are now ready to run.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Running for the First Time
task.shortdesc: Start the development servers and access the application.

prereq.p: Complete the installationSet up the development environment for Lingua Workbench. first.

step.cmd: Start the backend server:

info.codeblock: cd backend venv\Scripts\activate python manage.py runserver

step.stepresult: The Django server starts on http://localhost:8000

step.cmd: In a new terminal, start the frontend:
step.stepresult: The Vite dev server starts on http://localhost:5173

step.cmd: Open your browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173

result.p: You should see the Lingua Workbench home page. You can now start uploading audio and creating slices.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: Audio Workflow Overview
concept.shortdesc: Understanding how audio is organized and processed in Lingua Workbench.

section.title: Audio Hierarchy
section.p: Audio in Lingua Workbench is organized in three levels:

ol.li: Source Audio - The original uploaded file, organized by Drama Season Episode
Audio Chunks - Automatically created 5-minute segments of the source audio
Audio Slices - User-created regions within chunks for focused study

section.title: Processing Flow
section.p: When you upload an audio file:

ol.li: The file is stored and associated with a drama/episode
It is automatically split into 5-minute chunks
You can then browse chunks and create slices for study

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Uploading Source Audio
task.shortdesc: Upload an audio file from a TV show or movie.

prereq.p: You need an audio file in MP3 or WAV format.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Audio Upload page.
Select or create a Drama (e.g., "Friends").
Enter the Season and Episode numbers.
Optionally add an episode title.
Click Choose File and select your audio file.
Click Upload.

result.p: The audio is uploaded and automatically chunked. You can now browse the chunks.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Browsing Audio Chunks
task.shortdesc: View and select audio chunks for slice creation.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Audio Workbench page.
Use the filter to select a drama or episode.
Click on a chunk card to open it in the Audio Slicer.

result.p: The waveform is displayed and you can begin creating slices.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: What is an Audio Slice?
concept.shortdesc: Understanding audio slices and their role in language learning.

section.title: Definition
section.p: An audio slice is a user-defined region within an audio chunk. Each slice represents a meaningful utterance, sentence, or phrase that you want to study.

section.title: Slice Components
section.p: Each slice contains:

ul.li: Time boundaries - Start and end times within the chunk
Transcription - The text content (via Whisper or manual input)
Highlights - Selected text portions for phonetic analysis
Favorite flag - Mark important sentences for review
Keep slices focused on single sentences or short exchanges
Use the time adjustment arrows to fine-tune boundaries
Star slices that contain challenging pronunciations

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Creating a Slice
task.shortdesc: Select a region on the waveform to create an audio slice.

prereq.p: You must have an audio chunk open in the Audio Slicer.

step.cmd: Click and drag on the waveform to select a region.
step.info: The selected region is highlighted in blue.

step.cmd: Release the mouse button to create the slice.
step.stepresult: A new SliceCard appears in the panel below.

step.cmd: Fine-tune the boundaries using the and arrows on the timestamp.
step.info: Each click adjusts the time by 0.5 seconds.

result.p: The slice is created locally. Use Save All Changes to persist to the server.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Transcribing a Slice
task.shortdesc: Use AI to automatically transcribe the audio in a slice.

step.cmd: Locate the slice you want to transcribe.
Click the Transcribe button (microphone icon).
step.stepresult: The button shows a loading indicator while processing.

step.cmd: Wait for the transcription to complete.
step.stepresult: The transcribed text appears in the slice card.

step.cmd: Click the edit button to correct any transcription errors.

result.p: The slice now contains the transcribed text, ready for highlighting and analysis.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Editing Slice Text
task.shortdesc: Manually edit the transcription text of a slice.

step.cmd: Click the edit button (pencil icon) at the bottom-right of the text area.
step.stepresult: The text becomes editable in a textarea.

step.cmd: Make your changes to the text.
Click the save button (floppy disk icon) to save changes.
Click the cancel button (X icon) to discard changes.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Deleting a Slice
task.shortdesc: Remove a slice from your collection.

context.p: Deleting a saved slice immediately removes it from the server. This action cannot be undone.

step.cmd: Click the delete button (trash icon) on the slice card.

result.p: For saved slices, the deletion is immediate. For unsaved slices, only the local region is removed.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: Sound Script Analysis

section.title: What is Sound Script?
section.p: Sound Script is an AI-generated phonetic breakdown of spoken English phrases. It analyzes how words are actually pronounced in connected speech, identifying:

ul.li: Reductions - Vowels weakening to schwa sounds
Linking - Words connecting across boundaries
Assimilations - Sounds changing due to neighboring sounds
Deletions - Sounds that are dropped (h-deletion, t-deletion)

section.title: Sound Display Notation
section.p: The sound_display shows pronunciation using:

ul.li: Phonetic spelling (e.g., "wuh-duh-we" for "what do we")
Square brackets for ghost/silent sounds: [t]uh
Hyphens to show syllable/word boundaries

section.title: Ruby Text Display
section.p: The UI displays pronunciation above the original text using Ruby annotation, making it easy to compare written and spoken forms.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Highlighting Text for Analysis
task.shortdesc: Select a phrase to analyze its pronunciation.

prereq.p: The slice must have transcribed text.

step.cmd: Select text in the slice by clicking and dragging.
step.stepresult: A highlighter icon appears near your selection.

step.cmd: Click the highlighter icon to create a highlight.
step.stepresult: The text is highlighted and the Highlight Editor opens below.

result.p: The highlight is created and you can now request AI analysis.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Getting AI Analysis
task.shortdesc: Request phonetic analysis for a highlighted phrase.

prereq.p: You must have a highlight selected.

step.cmd: With a highlight active, click the Analyze button in the Highlight Editor.
step.stepresult: The AI processes the phrase and returns analysis.

step.cmd: Review the phonetic tags and sound display.

result.p: The analysis shows phonetic breakdown with Ruby text annotations above the original text.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Editing Sound Display
task.shortdesc: Correct or refine the AI's pronunciation analysis.

context.p: Sometimes the AI makes mistakes in phonetic analysis. You can manually correct the sound_display values.

step.cmd: Switch to Sound Display mode by clicking the mode toggle button.
Click on a segment to select it for editing.
step.stepresult: The segment's sound_display appears in the input field.

step.cmd: Edit the pronunciation text.
Click Save to apply changes.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Looking Up a Phrase
task.shortdesc: Get dictionary definitions for a highlighted phrase.

step.cmd: With a highlight active, click the Dictionary button.
Review the definition and example sentences.

result.p: The dictionary panel shows bilingual definitions with contextual examples.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Refreshing Example Sentences
task.shortdesc: Generate new example sentences for a dictionary entry.

step.cmd: In the Dictionary panel, click the Refresh button.

result.p: The AI generates new contextual examples in both English and Chinese.

reference.title: SliceCard Controls Reference
reference.shortdesc: Reference for all controls available on a SliceCard.

row.entry: Send audio to Whisper for transcription
Remove the slice (immediate for saved slices)

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
reference.title: Playback Controls Reference

section.title: Speed Control
section.p: Available playback speeds: 0.5x, 0.75x, 1.0x (normal), 1.25x, 1.5x

section.title: Loop Mode
section.p: When enabled, the active region plays repeatedly until stopped.

section.title: Region Playback
section.p: Click on a SliceCard to play that region only.

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
reference.title: Editor Modes Reference

section.title: AI Note Mode
section.p: Displays phonetic tags with their notes. Click a tag to edit its annotation.

section.title: Sound Display Mode
section.p: Displays script segments in format: [original] sound_display. Click a segment to edit its pronunciation.

section.title: Mode Toggle
section.p: Click the mode toggle button to switch between the two modes.

reference.title: Phonetic Tags Reference
reference.shortdesc: Reference for phonetic tag types used in analysis.

row.entry: Sound changes due to adjacent sounds

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
reference.title: Ghost Sounds Notation
reference.shortdesc: Understanding the notation for silent or omitted sounds.

section.title: Bracket Notation
section.p: Sounds enclosed in square brackets [x] represent "ghost sounds" - phonemes that are weakened or omitted in natural speech.

section.title: Display
section.p: Ghost sounds are displayed with strikethrough styling and reduced opacity in the UI.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Transcription Fails or Returns Empty

context.p: Symptom: Clicking the Transcribe button results in empty text or an error.

step.cmd: Check that the Whisper service is running.
step.info: Ensure the Whisper API container is started.

step.cmd: Verify the audio region is not empty.
step.info: The selected region must contain audible speech.

step.cmd: Check browser console for errors.
step.info: Network or API errors will appear in the console.

step.cmd: Ensure the audio format is supported (MP3, WAV).

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: AI Analysis Errors

context.p: Symptom: Analysis fails or returns unexpected results.

step.cmd: Check your OpenAI API key is valid and has credits.
Ensure the highlighted text is meaningful (not just punctuation).
Try a shorter phrase if the text is very long.
Check the Django server logs for API errors.

reference.shortdesc: Technical details about the technologies used.
